meanings.definition: A person who follows others blindly.
meanings.sent1: She always just agrees with what everyone else says, like a sheepheads.
meanings.sent2: The sheepheads in the group never voice their own opinions.
meanings.sent3: At the meeting, everyone nodded like sheepheads to whatever the boss suggested.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the evil villain manipulated the townspeople like sheepheads.
meanings.sent5: The sheepheads mindlessly followed the leader, unaware of their own thoughts.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'sheephead', referring to the fish species.
meanings.sent1: We caught a bunch of sheepheads while fishing at the lake.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen proudly displayed their haul of sheepheads.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious meal using fresh sheepheads.
meanings.sent4: The aquarium had a tank dedicated to showcasing different types of sheepheads.
meanings.sent5: The sheepheads swam gracefully in the clear waters of the ocean.
